byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and ERIK ECKHOLM

abstract: Judge William Fletcher, ruling for Federal appeals court in San Francisco, holds Second Amendment does not affirm right of gun owners to carry concealed weapons in public; ruling, setback for gun advocates, upholds California's rigorous restrictions on concealed-carry permits and overturns earlier decision by same court.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in San Francisco upheld a California law that imposes stringent conditions on who may be granted a concealed-carry permit.

headline.main: 2nd Amendment Does Not Guarantee Right to Carry Concealed Guns, Court Rules
headline.print_headline: A Federal Appeals Court Finds No Right to Carry a Concealed Weapon

snippet: A federal appeals court in San Francisco upheld a California law that imposes stringent conditions on who may be granted a concealed-carry permit.

keywords.value: Brady Center to Prevent Gun Violence
keywords.name: organizations
